page.title: 09Inverkeithing, the town.
page.content: The town of Inverkeithing is situated in the{South West}of Fife with a population of around{6210. Until{1974,}Inverkeithing was a {Royal Burgh}governed by a Provost. Nowadays it is part of{Dunfermline {District Council.}Much of the town is residential including major housing developments such as{Spencerfield}and {Hillfield.}The High Street is the major commercial centre with a wide range of shops and services while there are six churches in the town. Most of the population is employed at the Dockyard in Rosyth or at the nearby industrial estates. The town enjoys several sports and recreational services including four tennis courts and a swimming pool.
